selected_quotes: Data review (2015) Waist-to-height ratio for Japanese children from 1978-1981 national survey data

citation.abstract: OBJECTIVESTo construct waist-to-height ratio (WC/Ht) reference values and centile curves for Japanese children and to compare these references with those from other countries.METHODSThe 1978-1981 national survey data was used for reference and the 1992-1994 national survey data used for validation. The former included 19 233 children, and the latter included 10 446 children, age 6 to 18 years. Waist circumferences were measured at the level of maximum waist narrowing in girls, and at the level of the top of the iliac crest in boys. Age- and sex-specific reference curves were fitted with the LMS method. Cut-off points were arbitrarily set at 85th, 90th, 95th, and 97th centiles, and compared with WC/Ht 0.50.RESULTSThe proportion of children in whom WC/Ht exceeded 0.50 was 18.7% of boys and 1.9% of girls, whereas the proportion of children exceeding 90th centile was 42.4% for boys and 17.3% for girls, respectively. The reference values decreased with age in girls but varied by age without a clear trend in boys.CONCLUSIONSThe first reference values for WC/Ht are provided for Japanese youth based on the 1978-1981 national survey data. These curves are age- and sex-dependent, precluding the use of universal cut-off for WC/Ht of 0.50.International Journal of Obesity accepted article preview online, 07 October 2015. doi:10.1038/ijo.2015.203.
